did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: U.S. Department of Labor Women's Bureau "Women's Work Counts" Posters, 1995
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: US Department of Labor Women's Bureau 75th anniversary poster series.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Large format colorful posters produced for the 75th anniversary of the US Department of Labor Women's Bureau.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Department of Labor-- Archives

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: U.S. Department of Labor Women's Bureau "Women's Work Counts" Posters #6071 G. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Stylized depiction of factory, clerical, and professional women. Original artwork by Becky Heavener.
Original artwork by Varnette P. Honeywood
Depicted in advertising around a piece of Native American clothing. Original artwork by Jaune Quick-To-See Smith.
Pen, wrench, hammer, airplane, etc. Original artwork by Lonni Sue Johnson.
Central or South Native American. Original artwork by Mary Louise Lopez.
